intro: Sloanea alnifolia var. lancea, commonly known as the lance-leaf sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense rainforests. The plant has a woody stem and can grow as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters.
